other_tests.findings: Nonfunctioning pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors that were more than 2 cm in size; chromogranin A and synaptophysin present; loss of menin expression.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The pancreatic tumor in a 14-year-old girl grew from less than 2 cm to 2.1 cm over two years before undergoing surgery.

other_tests.findings: Presence of pancreatic tumors; at age 14, a pancreatic tumor was found to be less than 2 cm, and at age 12, another tumor was found to be 3.8 cm in size.
Well-differentiated pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors with uncertain malignant potential; loss of menin expression.
Tumors did not have significant expression of gastrointestinal hormones; strong immunostaining for chromogranin A and synaptophysin.
